alert.note: Alert for Lake; Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 29 at 4:10PM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Deland affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .Tropical Storm Ian will pull away from the FL peninsula today, with historic rainfall amounts reported across east central FL from the system. River levels along the Saint Johns will continue to rise as rainfall drains into the basin. The forecast point at Deland is currently in Minor Flood Stage and will reach Moderate Flood this evening. Levels will continue to rise to Major Flood this weekend, with a crest near 5.6 feet next week. Interests along the river should be prepared for major flood impacts to arrive over the few several days. For the St. Johns River...including Deland...Major flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 415 AM EDT. && ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St Johns River Near Deland. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 5.3 feet, Major flooding occurs to many structures and marinas along the river and in the Hontoon Island area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 4.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 PM EDT Thursday was 4.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 5.6 feet Tuesday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 4.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue St Johns River Deland 4.0 4.6 Thu 3 pm 4.9 5.2 5.5 5.5 MSG &&
